greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of solutions to x^5 + y^5 = z^5 mod n.
comment: Equivalently, the number of solutions to x^5 + y^5 + z^5 == 0 (mod n). - _Andrew Howroyd_, Jul 17 2018
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
program: (PARI) a(n)={my(p=Mod(sum(i=0, n-1, x^lift(Mod(i,n)^5)), 1-x^n)); polcoeff(lift(p^3), 0)} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Jul 17 2018
results.author: _Seiichi Manyama_, Jun 05 2017
